  • SAP

    SAP is paying archrival Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) $306M in damages to make a long-running intellectual...

    SAP is paying archrival Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) $306M in damages to make a long-running intellectual property theft suit go away. A jury awarded Oracle $1.3B in damages in 2010, but a judge lowered that figure to $272M last year. SAP has already paid $120M in legal fees to Oracle, and a $20M fine to the DOJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 PM | 1 Comment

  • KCG

    Knight Capital (KCG -62.8%) -12.4% AH on bankruptcy fears, even as it's reported  Goldman...

    Knight Capital (KCG -62.8%) -12.4% AH on bankruptcy fears, even as it's reported  Goldman and Sandler O'Neill have been hired to find a buyer. Knight's books have been opened up to P-E firms and at least one rival (Virtu Financial?). Bloomberg Businessweek provides the back-story for Knight's $440M loss. Between 9:30 and 10:00 AM ET yesterday, one of Knight's algorithms went haywire, pushing through 4M extra trades (550M shares) related to nearly 150 stocks. Update: Fox Business claims Virtu Financial isn't interested.

  • KOG

    More on Kodiak Oil's Q2: 12,696 BOE/day of sales in Q2, up 20% Q/Q and 385% Y/Y. 14 operated...

    More on Kodiak Oil's Q2: 12,696 BOE/day of sales in Q2, up 20% Q/Q and 385% Y/Y. 14 operated wells drilled and completed. DD&A expenses per BOE rose in Q2, other expenses declined. Credit facility borrow base increased by $150M to $375M. Estimated proved reserves stand at 70.1M BOE, +36% from end of 2011. CC at 11AM ET tomorrow (webcast). KOG +6.5% AH. (PR)

  • OPEN

    More on OpenTable's Q2: North American revenue up 18% Y/Y, international up 1%. North American...

    More on OpenTable's Q2: North American revenue up 18% Y/Y, international up 1%. North American diners +26% Y/Y, international +39% off a much smaller base. NA installed restaurant base +3% Q/Q to 18,373, international -18% due to removal of certain Toptable restaurants. SG&A expenses +41% Y/Y to $16.7M, much faster than revenue growth. Company expects 2012 revenue of $160M-$164M and EPS of $1.54-$1.66 vs. a consensus of $161.7M and $1.57. OPEN +11.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • SD

    More on SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD): Q2 EPS beats but revenue misses, albeit only slightly, on a...

    More on SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD): Q2 EPS beats but revenue misses, albeit only slightly, on a 31% jump in total revenue. Company raises FY12 production guidance by 700M boe to 33MM boe, a 54% increase in oil production and a 41% Y/Y increase in total production from 2011. CapEx projections upped to $2.1B from $1.85B, primarily due to accelerated infrastructure activity resulting from drilling success in the Mississippian play. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 3 Comments

  • ON

    Announced in tandem with ON Semiconductor's Q2 report: 1) The company and CFO Donald Colvin have...

    Announced in tandem with ON Semiconductor's Q2 report: 1) The company and CFO Donald Colvin have "mutually agreed" Colvin should resign. He'll be gone in 90 days, and a search has begun for a replacement. 2) A $300M stock buyback program has been approved. That's good for buying over 10% of shares at current levels. 3) ON is guiding for Q3 revenue of $725M-$765M, below an $803M consensus. Gross margin is expected to fall by 120-220 bps. ONNN -6.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q2 EPS of $0.16 in-line. Revenue of $228.2M (+89% Y/Y) beats by $12.5M. Expects...

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q2 EPS of $0.16 in-line. Revenue of $228.2M (+89% Y/Y) beats by $12.5M. Expects Q3 revenue of $235M-$240M, mostly above $235.2M consensus. Expects 2012 revenue of $915M-$925M, above $908.4M consensus. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)

    PDL BioPharma (NASDAQ:PDLI): Q2 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $12.9M (+3.1% Y/Y)...

  • Hornbeck Offshore Services ([[HOS] -14%) closes out the day punished with a big loss after...

    Hornbeck Offshore Services ([[HOS] -14%) closes out the day punished with a big loss after missing on its Q2 earlier. The miss largely masked an impressive 63% Y/Y increase in revenue, as the provider of offshore supply vessels to the energy industry continued to see improved demand in its key upstream business.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • ONE

    Higher One (ONE +7.7%) pops on word that the company hired Goldman Sachs to look for a buyer....

    Higher One (ONE +7.7%) pops on word that the company hired Goldman Sachs to look for a buyer. Tuition processing rivals SLM (SLM -1.3%) and PNC Financial (PNC -1.1%) trade lower for the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • MDAS

    Shares of MedAssets (MDAS +19.8%) power forward against a weak tape after easily beating on its...

    Shares of MedAssets (MDAS +19.8%) power forward against a weak tape after easily beating on its Q2 top and bottom line. The company also raised guidance, now seeing its FY12 EPS between $1.05 - $1.13 on revenue of around $620M - $630M. Street estimates are for an EPS of $1.06 on revenue of $608M. Raymond James ups the shares to Strong Buy on the back of the strong result.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • NAV

    Shares of truckmaking companies leg down briefly after rumors surface about July Class 8 truck...

    Shares of truckmaking companies leg down briefly after rumors surface about July Class 8 truck orders tracking below expectations: NAV -14%, PCAR -3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • IPI

    Intrepid Potash (IPI -6.8%) slumps following its Q2 report. Though EPS beat estimates and...

    Intrepid Potash (IPI -6.8%) slumps following its Q2 report. Though EPS beat estimates and revenue was in-line, the fertilizer maker said there's "more downside risk" to U.S. corn and (possibly) soybean yield forecasts, given drought conditions in much of the Midwest. Also, while Intrepid is confident 2H potash demand will be strong, it remains uncertain about the timing of purchases.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM

  • UBS analyst Marc Goodman weighs in on Bristol Myers ([[BMY] -8.3%) suspension of its hepatitis C...

    UBS analyst Marc Goodman weighs in on Bristol Myers ([[BMY] -8.3%) suspension of its hepatitis C drug study, saying that prior concerns about over paying for Inhibitex - which was purchased to obtain this very asset - were well grounded. Unless management can salvage the data and revive the study, which at minimum means a potential delay of a year or more, it runs the real risk of losing its entire oral hep-C program.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM

  • Murphy Oil ([[MUR] -2.3%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q2 report earlier today. Bottom...

    Murphy Oil ([[MUR] -2.3%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q2 report earlier today. Bottom line results beat expectations, but top line revenues fell far wide of the mark, -5% Y/Y, as the oil-and-gas producer struggled with falling prices. The company says its U.S retail business continues to under perform due to depressed natural gas prices, and that a potential spin-off still remains on the table. It also boosted its quarterly dividend to $0.3125 a share, up from $0.275 cents.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Sprint (S -3.8%) discloses in its Q2 10-Q the SEC recently "issued a formal order of...

    Sprint (S -3.8%) discloses in its Q2 10-Q the SEC recently "issued a formal order of investigation" related to its sales tax collections. The investigation comes after New York's AG filed a $300M+ suit in April over Sprint's alleged failure to collect $100M+ in sales taxes over 7 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • MT

    Steel and Iron stocks are generally lower after S&P cut ArcelorMittal (MT -11.8%) to BB+/B...

    Steel and Iron stocks are generally lower after S&P cut ArcelorMittal (MT -11.8%) to BB+/B with a negative outlook earlier today. The agency cites the recent downward revision of its European GDP forecast and ongoing weakness in the steel industry: Cliffs Natural (CLF -5.3%), U.S. Steel (X -4.7%) and AK Steel (AKS -9.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • MVIS

    Microvision (MVIS +9.4%) rallies after reporting Q2 revenue of $1.3M (+12% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Microvision (MVIS +9.4%) rallies after reporting Q2 revenue of $1.3M (+12% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.26; the former missed by $0.3M, but the latter beat by $0.08. Microvision, which has been posting losses for many years, says samples of its PicoP Gen2 display projection engine have been shipped to over a dozen companies. 13.3% of Microvision's float was shorted as of July 13. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • LEA

    Lear (LEA +1.2%) trades up after beating Q2 estimates this morning, despite continuing signs of...

    Lear (LEA +1.2%) trades up after beating Q2 estimates this morning, despite continuing signs of a weak global market for its products. Net profit dropped 18% Y/Y as European business continues to suffer amid decline in sales and a double-digit drop in revenue, leaving its North American segment to surpass Europe as the auto-parts supplier's largest market. Gross margins shrank to 8.6% from 9.4% on higher operating costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • LLNW

    Limelight (LLNW -6.8%) isn't witnessing the kind of turnaround larger rival Akamai (AKAM -1.7%)...

    Limelight (LLNW -6.8%) isn't witnessing the kind of turnaround larger rival Akamai (AKAM -1.7%) has lately seen. Shares of the the content delivery network owner are diving after it missed Q2 top-line forecasts and issued soft Q3 guidance (revenue of $44M-$45.5M vs. $47.4M consensus). Limelight's greater dependence on low-margin media delivery services appears to be a culprit. During its earnings call, Limelight said it was being "selective" in choosing deals due to capex concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • EYPT

    Shares of pSivida (PSDV -12%) slide after it says it's entered into a securities purchase...

    Shares of pSivida (PSDV -12%) slide after it says it's entered into a securities purchase agreement with institutional investors to raise approximately $5.36M in a direct offering. The company plans to sell, in units, around 2.5M shares of common stock and warrants to purchase 624K shares of its common stock, at a price of $2.15 per unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • ITRI

    Itron (ITRI +9.5%) jumps after soundly beating Q2 estimates with the help of a 270 bps Y/Y...

    Itron (ITRI +9.5%) jumps after soundly beating Q2 estimates with the help of a 270 bps Y/Y improvement in gross margin. The smart meter vendor guided for 2012 revenue of $2.1B-$2.2B and EPS of $3.80-$4 - the former is below a $2.24B consensus, but the latter is largely above a Street forecast of $3.80. During its earnings call, Itron talked up the growth outlook for its water meter business, which it hopes will offset slower demand for gas meters.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers International (WTW -12%) gets body-slammed today after its Q2 top line missed...

    Weight Watchers International (WTW -12%) gets body-slammed today after its Q2 top line missed estimates late yesterday. Net earnings fell 11% Y/Y as revenue growth at its Internet business largely was offset by lower sales in its meeting business. The company also cut its FY12 guidance by $0.60 to between $4.00 and $4.20 per share, citing weaking consumer trends and higher spending to combat increased competition from peers like Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY -0.1%), Jenny Craig Nutrisystem (NTRI -1.8%) and Medifast (NYSE:MED).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -4%) can't catch a break. Shares are making new lows again, and are now barely...

    Facebook (FB -4%) can't catch a break. Shares are making new lows again, and are now barely above $20. The selloff has become bad enough that California may have to revise its budget assumptions. Facebook has received some more bad PR (previous) courtesy of developer Dalton Caldwell, who accuses Facebook execs of threatening to crush an app he was building (allegedly for affecting Facebook's ad sales) if he didn't agree to sell his company.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 14 Comments
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (HK +9.1%) beats Q2 earnings expectations and discloses a new liquids-rich...

    Halcon Resources (HK +9.1%) beats Q2 earnings expectations and discloses a new liquids-rich exploratory play in the Midway-Navarro formations in Texas. HK expects to build a position of 25K-75K net acres in the play, and will utilize one rig in the region to spud four to six wells this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • YELP

    Amidst the carnage of recent consumer Web IPOs, Yelp (YELP +22.5%) has become a standout. Shares...

    Amidst the carnage of recent consumer Web IPOs, Yelp (YELP +22.5%) has become a standout. Shares are taking off after Yelp beat Q2 estimates, raised guidance, and reported a 9% Q/Q increase in monthly unique users to 78M. During its earnings call,  Yelp noted click-through rates for ads on it site are much higher on mobile devices than PCs (no ads are shown on its apps for now). Google (NASDAQ:GOOG), which has talked up the value of local ads on mobile devices, can take heart in that.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • SLTM

    Solta Medical (SLTM -13%) trades down today after pricing its 5.7M share offering at $2.65 per...

    Solta Medical (SLTM -13%) trades down today after pricing its 5.7M share offering at $2.65 per share, a 17% discount to Wednesday's close. The deep discount should be taken in perspective, however. The stock had risen over 170% - since last October. Net proceeds from the sale total around $14M, and the company plans to use the funds for general corporate purposes. This points more to an opportunistic move by the company to cash in on a big move rather than any pressing need to raise funds.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +12.1%) shares surge after Q2 earnings rose 78% on improving gross refining margins...

    Tesoro (TSO +12.1%) shares surge after Q2 earnings rose 78% on improving gross refining margins and lower expenses. CEO Greg Goff says TSO expects shipments of cheaper Bakken crude to its Washington state refinery will start as planned in September and ramp up to 50K bbl/day, more than expected, from an initial 30K bbl/day by year's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • JVA

    Shares of Coffee Holding (JVA +9.9%) ride the coattails of Green Mountain Coffee's rally to hit...

    Shares of Coffee Holding (JVA +9.9%) ride the coattails of Green Mountain Coffee's rally to hit their highest level in nearly a month. More than any other coffee name, JVA seems to mirror the action on GMCR leading some to wonder if the three-month slide in share price is fully warranted.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +24.5%) skyrockets after a strong Q2 report that featured improving margins...

    First Solar (FSLR +24.5%) skyrockets after a strong Q2 report that featured improving margins and receivables. Four firms are upgrading - among them is Cantor, which is now more confident about FSLR's ability to transition to a construction-focused business model. However, Deutsche and Needham express worries about the profitability of construction deals, and ongoing weakness in sales for 3rd-party installations. 55.8% of FSLR's float was shorted as of July 13. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 3 Comments
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +8.3%) says it plans to partner with Mylan (MYL -1.5%), Ranbaxy...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +8.3%) says it plans to partner with Mylan (MYL -1.5%), Ranbaxy Laboratories (OTC:RBXZF) and Strides Arcolab to promote access to generic versions of Gilead's HIV medicine containing Emtricitabine in developing countries. The drug is marketed by GILD under the brand names Emtriva and Truvada. WHO guidelines recommend the drug as preferred components of first and second line HIV therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • NTR

    Dahlman Rose turns cautious on fertilizer shares, believing upside from the 2013-14 crop has...

    Dahlman Rose turns cautious on fertilizer shares, believing upside from the 2013-14 crop has largely played out and drought conditions introduce a multitude of downside risks which outweigh the rewards, especially if ethanol comes into the mix. The firm downgrades POT -2.4%, AGU -0.2% and RNF -1.6% to Hold but keeps MOS -1.2% and CF -0.2% at Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARO

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO -32.8%) crater after the company its outlook for revenue. The...

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO -32.8%) crater after the company its outlook for revenue. The youth-focused retailer posted flat sales in Q2 and now expects to break even for the period after earlier estimates called for $0.03-$0.05 per share profit. (Earlier: The sweet spot for retail)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • ELOQ

    After pricing its 8M share IPO at $11.50, Eloqua (NASDAQ:ELOQ) opened for trading at $11.80 and...

    After pricing its 8M share IPO at $11.50, Eloqua (NASDAQ:ELOQ) opened for trading at $11.80 and is currently moving at $11.91, up 3.6%.
